cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 345 mi SSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing north-northeast today, then turning northeast and accelerating; forecast to skirt the Outer Banks of North Carolina Monday and move east-northeast away from the U.S. East Coast by Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the Outer Banks, NC (no direct U.S. landfall expected)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Surf City to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. coast from Florida through North Carolina with swell and surf extending northward along the mid-Atlantic coast, including Virginia
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (forecast amounts <2 in for SE Virginia)
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of tropical-storm-force gusts possible Monday afternoon–evening; sustained winds most likely 20–30 kt
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation or high surf possible, but significant surge (>3 ft) not expected in Hampton Roads
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rainfall Monday could total 1–2 inches with locally higher amounts, mainly outer coastal areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough seas impacting vessel operations and pilotage in Chesapeake Bay entrance
